## PythonHttpServerReader class

Directory reader for Python's built-in `http.server` (and similar) HTML directory listings.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare class PythonHttpServerReader implements HttpDirectoryReader 
```
**Implements:** [HttpDirectoryReader](doc/markdown/./base.httpdirectoryreader.md)

## Remarks

- Detects pages served by Python's `http.server` by scanning the `<title>` or `<h1>` tags. - Parses `<ul><li><a>` (default Python layout) and falls back to plain `<a>` links. - Skips parent directory entries (`../`<!-- -->), external links, and anchors. - Attempts to extract file size and modification date from the link's surrounding text. - Normalizes resolved paths via the provided `HttpDirectoryReaderContext`<!-- -->.

Limitations: - Parsing depends on the server's HTML structure; non-standard variants may not be fully parsed. - Size and date extraction are best-effort and may be unavailable in some cases.
